instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fails "Sensor Group Test 7" in ASD?
threads.message:
I've got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board that seems to work fine, but it fails the "Sensor Group Test #7" on ASD, but it doesn't give any indication of which sensor fails. I know there are several it checks, but is there a way to narrow down which sensor exactly has failed?

Thanks in advance!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fails "Sensor Group Test 7" in ASD?
threads.message: Also, somewhat related; I haven't had a chance to work on any 2015 model MBPr 15" machines yet; is the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> compatible/interchangeable with the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (I think that's the 2015 15" board model) board? I had a customer ask, and I'm not entirely certain. I know the 2015 models had some sort of LCD identifier information in the LCD assembly or something, correct? I want to make sure I don't mis-inform them.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fails "Sensor Group Test 7" in ASD?
threads.message: Run EFI version of ASD to get the truth, not OS

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fails "Sensor Group Test 7" in ASD?
threads.message: Thanks, Louis. I'll do that and see what's up--thanks.
